comment.text: Amazing food, even better service. Our waiter was awesome, had clear knowledge of the menu, and was very comforting and kind in general. The vibe of the restaurant as a whole was fantastic and we would recommend it to anyone looking for good food in Atlanta.

I don't think I have ever been disappointed when I stop by Poor Calvin's. But finally the ox tail we have been waiting for is finally back on the day we stop by for my birthday dinner. 
The ox-tail was the high light of the night. My favorite curry flavor out of all the dishes here. It was fall of the bone good. The curry is so good with everything rice or the leftover bread from the mussel dish. 
We also had the staple duck dynasty which never disappoints. 
The mussel is a new dish and we loved it. I can dip in that sauce all day if they bring me more bread. 
Pad see ew was good but the pad thai is much better. 
The seafood curry is also a very good staple choice as you cannot go wrong with it. 
I have to setup a notification with the staff to get a notification sent to my phone whenever they make the oxtail special so I can come back for more.

photos.caption: Duck dynasty - always a safe choice
Ox-tail Vietnamese curry is a must try. Even if it's expensive at $65 it is totally worth it.
Mussel is really refreshing with the thai sauce.
Pad see ew is good but pad thai is much better

comment.text:
I've been to Poor Calvin's a total of 4 times and everytime I go, I think I should go more often. To me, the restaurant represents what is unique about the Atlanta food scene which is fusion concepts. My wife and I were taking out a friend this time to celebrate. It's a higher end dining experience but well worth the money. As a small warning because it is popular, it can get crowded and as a result the ambiance can be a bit loud to those expecting a quieter dining experience.

Onto the food. We got three appetitzers - the fried frog leg, the deviled egg with crab, and the lobster crawfish wanton. They were all fantastic and I highly recommend them. If I were to rank them, I'd say I'd pick the fried frog leg, the devil egg with crab and then the lobster crawfish wanton but that's because I was in a savory mood.

I ended up getting the Duck Dynasty. The scallops were ridiculously good and the duck was tender eith the skin nicely crisp. My wife got the off menu special which was a trout stuffed with crab.

As always, a top level experience. Everyone who loves food and fusion needs to go.

Let me start this review by saying I've eaten at a lot of restaurants in Atlanta over the years, A LOT,  & Poor Calvin's is hands down the best of the best! I can not stress enough how fantastic our first experience was at Poor Calvin's. From being greeted as soon as we walked into the 'thank yous' walking out the door after dinner, top tier experience. 

Our server, Ashley. Let's start with her. There are not enough stars to represent the service we received from Ashley. She was knowledgeable of the menu, offered great recommendations, & provided overall exceptional service. Ashley is the kind of server others should aspire to be. 

I ordered the lychee martini (DELICIOUS! So refreshing, sweet, & strong! I would have ordered more than 2 if I weren't driving), the Lemongrass Steamed Mussels (OUTSTANDING!!), & the Australian Lamb Chops (AMAZING & seasoned to perfection!). 

My dad ordered the Lobster Crawfish Wonton (he said they were very good) & the Oxtail Curry dish that was the special of the day. OMG! It was so delicious. I wish I'd ordered it for my entrée (I sampled some of his). I should have ordered an entrée of the Oxtail Curry to go. 

My aunt ordered the Lobster Mac & Cheese & enjoyed it. She said it was the perfect balance of lobster & macaroni & cheese. My uncle ordered the Deviled Eggs with Crab (Bougie Deviled Eggs, as he called them) and the Lobster Fried Rice. He raved about both of his dishes. 

Every flavor paired magically together for everything we ate. We are planning to return next month & are hoping the oxtails are on the menu. If so, I can place my order now. 


Things to know:
1. As everyone else has said, parking is limited. Go early if possible!
2. Parties of 5 or more are put on one ticket. We learned that on our way to the restaurant. No issue but something to be mindful of if you have a large party.

Visited here with a large party. We came on a Monday in the summer and dined outside. It was still busy for a Monday. I ordered the Duck Dynasty and it was wonderful! Loved tenderness of duck and the shrimp was savory as well. Staff was nice. They even obliged us a group picture. Great atmosphere for food and drinks.

November 2023 
My first dinner in Atlanta recommended by my Uber driver. We got lucky and our group of 5 didn't have a reservation but there was no wait. 
Everything here was unique, flavorful, and fusion. 
The gochujang brushed lamb chops melted in my mouth. 
The lobster fried rice was flavorful and a large portion. 
The fried chicken wasn't my personal favorite but was full of Thai flavor, with collard greens, and lobster mac. 

The vibes were immaculate and our waiter was super cool

photos.caption: Fried Chicken, Grilled Australian Lamb Chops
Fried Chicken, Grilled Australian Lamb Chops, Lobster Fried Rice

comment.text: Oh my god! I don't know where to start. This place is heaven on earth. Everything is soooo good that words can't describe it. You can see the love and passion of chef in the food, ambience and staff. Everything speaks of how much love has been put into this place. Lamb Chops and Lobster Fried Rice are must must must try. Suspension bridge is not a regular red velvet cake. It dissolves and has very less sugar in it. I am guilty of eating whole of it by myself but I will do it again. And ofcourse the person who took care of our table was amazing!

Poor Calvin's is a Midtown institution, serving excellent Asian fusion cuisine. 

Location and Parking 
Located on Piedmont Rd, parking is free along the street in front of the restaurant. 

Venue and Atmosphere 
The interior is decorated with luxurious velvet furniture, mood lighting, and gold statues.  There are fresh flowers on every table and plenty of windows for natural light. 

Service 
Service was prompt, courteous, and efficient. Our server game us plenty of suggestions and tasting notes as well. 

Food and Beverages 
Everything, from the cocktails to the entrees, was perfectly seasoned and presented beautifully. The Rum punch has several types of liquor but is well balanced with sweetness. The Bok-choy was  tender and sautéed well. The seafood curry was absolutely delicious, as was the fried chicken. The hint of coconut milk in the collard greens was unexpected, but tasty. Also, the lobster Mac and cheese gets 5-stars alone. 

Verdict 
This is my third time dining here, and I'll definitely return!

photos.caption: Fried chicken with greens and seafood Mac & Cheese

comment.text:
This place was one of the highlights of my Atlanta trip. Everything was a 10/10 from the service, food, and ambience of the restaurant. It looks small from the outside but it is so cute and nice inside and was busy so definitely make reservations. 

The menu, portions, and quality of the food was fantastic. 
For appetizers we got the lobster and crawfish wontons and lychee martinis. Both were so good. The wontons were a GREAT appetizer and so yummy.

For dinner we got the grilled australian lamb chops and lobster fried rice. Both these dishes had a beautiful presentation and were so flavorful we literally ate every single bite with no leftovers. My friend is a picky eater and doesn't even eat lamb chops usually and LOVED both plates. Everything was cooked to perfection.

Dessert was sooo hard to choose from. Our server came to our corner of the restaurant and described each dessert dish to everyone so well that we were discussing what to get with other tables. We went with the toasted pound cake and was literally obsessed. I'm not even a banana fan and it was still amazing to me. The other tables around us who got every other dessert said everything else amazing too so clearly you can't go wrong. This whole dining experience was great.

photos.caption: Lobster Fried Rice and Grilled Australian Lamb Chops

comment.text:
A restaurant has to be pretty amazing for me to give it five stars. My husband and I dined here on Saturday evening for date night. Andre was our waiter and he was excellent!

We ordered the lemongrass mussels for our appetizer and my husband wanted to take the broth home it was that delicious!

For our main course: he ordered the fried grouper and I ordered the lamp chops. Both dishes were extremely flavorful and mouthwatering. The lamp chops were amazing!!!

I would get those again! My husband enjoyed the grouper as well.

The presentation of the food is magazine worthy and the portion sizes of the dishes were great as well!

For dessert, we ordered the toasted pound cake. It was interesting but not in a bad way.

Hands down I would go here again for the food!

As for the restaurant: The restaurant is fairly small, not a lot of seating so if you're looking for an intimate,  romantic space this could be it if you don't mind hearing the conversation of others or vice versus. I would not recommend Poor Calvin's for a private date night with your significant other, not too much privacy. Other than that you won't be disappointed with the food!

 5 stars for the food!

I always have a fantastic time when I dine here, so it's always a treat when I get to go!

I had reservations on NYE and was promptly greeted and sat. The location isn't large and is dimly lit so that makes it feel like a more intimate setting. Great for a date night or dinner w: a small group -- though the food is great, it wouldn't be my top pick for a large group. Throughout our dining experience, our waitress Ashley was personable and made great recommendations. They make sure to accommodate any allergies or dietary restrictions your party may have as well as run down any specials on their appetizers or entrees. (Pro tip: someone should always order the special, they hardly repeat so they're prettyyyy exclusive!) 

Last time, I got the crispy beef which is absolutely tasty and like a yummy stir fry. I've also tried their lobster Mac & cheese which is equally delish and not absent of the lobster they promise. This time I got the pad Thai which I really liked. It was vegetable heavy, the lobster and shrimp were both very fresh, and it was just an overall party in my mouth! Also, the portions are always large enough for at least 2 meals :-) 

The price range is pretty moderate, but for the quality and experience it is very much worth it. 

I hope to come back in the future for their brunch and seafood curry my friend raves about.

photos.caption: Pad Thai Tiger Shrimp and Half Lobster Tail

comment.text:
For our last meal of the year we dined at an intown favorite. This place has been here for ages as the neighborhood has evolved. Poor Calvin's still has the best service, food and charming atmosphere for a special occasion, date night or to sample the menu.

Our server Anthony was gracious, informative and friendly. He was very attentive and could rattle off the ingredients of the offerings without a hiccup. We went with the Wild Rum Punch cocktail to start, then Seafood Spring Rolls and the Crab Deviled Eggs.
For dinner was the coconut soup and Lobster Fried Rice (signature dish). Then for dessert was the Apple Cobbler empanadas topped with vanilla ice cream. Everything was superb. 
It's been a few years since I'd dined here. The menu never disappoints. 

Things to note - reservations are suggested. This place stays busy and the footprint is fairly small. The bar holds about six chairs. There's an outdoor patio in front and the back is enclosed. Also 19% gratuity is included on every ticket. Parking is a small lot beside the restaurant otherwise check the signs so you're not booted or towed. 

I want to thank my Yelp Elite Atlanta crew for this gift (won raffle) to enjoy a delicious lunch to wrap up 2023! I won't stay away as long again!

photos.caption: Deviled Egg with crab & SEAFOOD SPRING ROLLS

comment.text: Poor Calvin's was a beautiful and intimate experience, I had the chance to taste special, newly added dishes from Chef Calvin's previous food tour. The service was clear and comforting. Our waiter gave amazing recommendations and went more into details about the Chef's adventures that inspired the menu, which change as he travels.

My favorite restaurant in all of Georgia, and the hype is worth it so make sure to make a reservation! 

First of all, the food is so distinguished and delicious! Portions are generous, definitely should do family style so you can try it all. My favorite app has to be the lobster crawfish wontons-- it was surprisingly flavorful, and the runner up is the lemongrass steamed mussels. They don't skimp out on the mussels, and you've got to dip the bread in the sauce. I've also tried the shaky shrimp and buttermilk fried frog legs which were also good. 
I've also loved every entree I've tried here-- the lobster fried rice, grass fed australian lamb chops, and the duck dynasty. 
Cocktails are also all a hit. I recommend the NIrvana Nectar, Lychee Martini, and Pho :) 

Service was also amazing!! I LOVED my server Ngoc. He was so pleasant and knowledgeable about everything on the menus. 

There is a small lot for parking, and some street parking available. 

TLDR; make the reservation now :)

photos.caption: Lobster Fried Rice , Grilled Australian Lamb Chops

comment.text:
I was visiting friends in Atlanta, and Poor Calvin's was the last meal for this trip. 
Have you ever fully embraced the expression..."Save the best for last!" ?
We were quite fortunate to get a reservation. Once we arrived.... we were greeted and welcomed warmly.  Our waiter, TJ, promptly attended to our table.
After placing our drink orders... he inquired about our visit and gave us the history of the restaurant and Chef Calvin. (*bonus points*)

If you're looking for something that's delicious enough to make your taste buds dance then sound the alarm and head over to Poor Calvin's. Once the food arrives at the table.... there's complete silence.  

We had the seafood spring rolls, fried chicken, lamb chops and the fried grouper.  Take a look at the colors, consistency ingredients and if you want to know more you'll have to go try it for yourself because the pictures only tell half the experience.

photos.caption: Lamb Chops with asparagus and plantains
Chocolate over mascarpone and a thin sheet of chocolate on the bottom.  A few strawberries off to the side.  It's shareable!!
Fried Grouper in a pineapple shell
Fried Chicken with Greens and Mac & Cheese
Fried Grouper in a pineapple shell

comment.text: Mmm mmm mm!! Such a gem!! Greatttt variety of plates that you can choose from, everything is awesome!! Great service is always a plus & they have yet to fail me, every time! There's a bar vibe which will take walk ins & then there is dinning areas which are 9-10 reservation only because they're always so booked & busy, however i have gotten lucky at times! There were times we also did not get so lucky! 10/10 recommend! I also tried this cute, ginger like honey drink (forgot the name) pretty good! It did give me a vibe of cold tea when you're sick just with liquor, which i do not mind! It was unique but great.

photos.caption: I forget the name of this Salad 10/10 , Lobster Macaroni and Cheese, friend chicken breast & yummy sweet greens!
I loved this! HERS so that i would know which left overs were mine! So cute!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you Dolly for remembering us, Nirvana Nectar was your cocktail that night, James

comment.text:
Tl;Dr: Large and hearty portions and flavors. Fun asian/southern fusion with excellent service and atmosphere. Try it once for the novelty 

A very nicely decorated restaurant with excellent service. All the dishes we got had huge portions so I would say 1 entree per person would fill you up. It's a very enjoyable experience with delicious dishes but personally, I wouldn't say that any of them were as composed or elevated as I would have hoped. Still very satisfying and comforting! 

Lobster fried rice: Get!
The portion was a lot larger than I expected and it was very filling. The dish itself was very hearty and savory with lots and lots of lobster flavors so that was appreciated. I do wish it was cut with some more acidity to add more to the complexity but it was still very flavorful. 

Shrimp grits: Maybe get? 
It seems to be their vibe that they love their hearty dishes and of course these cheesy grits is no exception. it's delicious and comforting but I wouldn't say it's enough to warrant more than $30 for this. The sausage added a nice funky bite to the taste and the shrimp was perfectly cooked though. 

Lobster mac and cheese: Sure! 
A fun loaded mac and cheese that's--you guessed it--very hearty and comforting. Gotta throw lobster on it too because why else are you at this restaurant? It's nothing too remarkable but if you want a seafood based mac n cheese to indulge those guilty pleasures then go for it. 

Service: Excellent
Waters refilled constantly (maybe a little too much lol). Servers were very eloquent with the menu items and recommendations. I appreciate it a lot 

Food: 7/10 
Atmosphere: 9/10 
Service: 9/10 
Value: 6/10
Desert at one of the best restaurant experiences in a long time. Anthony was AWESOME! Food was AWESOME! Ambiance was AWESOME!. Thanks Poor Calvin's!!!

photos.caption: Peach apple empanadas with homemade pistachio ice cream.

comment.text:
I was thoroughly pleased with my experience at Poor Calvin's. The food and service were phenomenal! I came for a small birthday dinner with a party of 5.  

We had reservations for 5pm right when they open and before opening there was already a line forming. We were seated when all of our party arrived. 

Our sever Anthony was wonderful from beginning to end. Very attentive, patient, and polite. Food came out at a perfect pace. The table was consistently cleared of dirty dishes and drinks were always filled. Anthony was amazing!

The food was amazing. For appetizers we had the Frog Legs, Seafood Spring Rolls, Lobster Mac and Fried Calamari which were all delicious and great portions. For entrees we had the Seafood Curry, Fried Grouper, Fried Chicken. All were excellent and satisfying portions.

Overall I was very happy with my experience here. I'd recommend coming solo dolo, on a date, or with a small group of friends. The restaurant is pretty small and seating is tight and they don't take reservations over 6 ppl. Wonderful food excellent service will definitely be back!

The first time I had this place was over four years ago and I've been wanting to go back ever since but it was never the right time lol and getting a reservation on a weekend can be difficult if you don't plan in advance. I finally was able to try it again and it was just as good! 
I would recommend making a reservation for as soon as they open and getting there about 15 minutes early so that you can park in their small parking lot. The seating can be tight but the decor is beautiful!!!
The "special" or "seasonal" dumplings they had for a starter were amazing! I couldn't choose between all the appetizers they have but went with these and was really pleased.
I also had a honey, ginger cocktail which was sooo good.
For my entree I ordered the lamb chops with everything on it. It's really impressive how all of the food was so appetizing, and the quality of the food is top notch. I even tried some of my husband's fried chicken with Mac and cheese and it was delicious too! 
Our server was very knowledgeable and attentive.
A must try in Atlanta.

As I continued my walk home, since I was 40 minutes out of midtown, I decided to walk here and arrived just a little after they opened.  I didn't have a reservation, and asked to sit at the bar.  I felt I was a little too casual but they were welcoming and friendly and I got the best seat in the house.  I could see all the drinks being made and ask what they were.

Taylor? the bartender told me that they changed the cocktail menu and I told him to choose one of the new ones for me.  He brought the Mt. Fuji, soooo good!

Me: Is it because I'm Asian? 
He: O-o*
Me: I'm just kidding!

He then told me about the croquettes special and the grilled duck in curry entree with a lobster tail...I ordered both!  Why not?  The croquettes were tasty and I loved the slaw that came with them.  The duck was perfect!  The curry was delicious!!!  I didn't know I had to work for my food, but that lobster tail was soooo good with the sauce!  I loved the rice that came with, because again that curry was soooo good!  Taylor also picked out a wine for me, and wouldn't you know, it was a Malbec...my go to and favorite.

After I was done, he told me and the guy sitting next to me, about the dessert special, chocolate cake with ube filling.  Why not right?  Imagine our surprise when this ginormous wedge was brought out!  I couldn't finish it all so I took the rest home and had it for breakfast the next morning.  I mean, why not, right?

My friend I was visiting told me to say hi to Griffin, and he is one of the hosts.  We had a great conversation, and Yo and I came back the next evening.  Melek? was our bartender and he made us some wicked fun cocktails! What a fun place to come to!  I'm glad I stopped in!  I now have somewhere fun and familiar when I come back!

photos.caption: Duck curry special with lobster tail
This was what the duck came in
Ginormous cake...ask what's available and just get it!!!

comment.text: I was in Atlanta for only a few days and had never been there before, so I checked Yelp to see what restaurants were near my hotel and this one had close to 5 stars so I had to try it.  Thanks God I did, because the lobster fried rice dish was maybe the best dish I have had in 2024 so far.  The service and ambiance were impeccable and the menu has something for everyone.  I also had the frog legs which were also amazing.

Everything about this place was absolute 100! From service to food to decor, all 100! We had one of their specials and I couldn't remember what the dish was called but it was braised short rib in a curry that was sooooo flavorful!! 

I would come back to Atlanta just to try more dishes here! Maybe come with a big group because portions are huge and then you'll get to try other things!!

photos.caption: This was one of their short rib specials. Sooooo goood

comment.text: PC is still 5 stars in our book! Service is still top-notch. On our most recent visit, we brought along the toddler. Our service staff took the time to engage with her multiple times throughout our dinner. The food is still wonderful. Notable items on our recent visit were the Pho cocktail (lovingly called the Phoctail - nobody calls it that) and the candy apple dessert thing. The candy apple came recommended by our server. I wouldn't normally have gravitated to its description, but we were SO glad to have obliged. Ours was dressed with a delicious pandan drizzle that kept us going in and forget about just how huge the dessert was when it was served. All of a sudden, we weren't so stuffed from the entrees and apps! PC always delivers.

In town for the weekend and loved loved loved this place after it was recommended by a friend. The service was fantastic - huge shoutout to Lena! Throughout the dinner our waters were filled, our questions were answered, and she consistently made sure our experience was going well. They even gave us a complimentary scoop of home made ice cream at the end and it was delicious! The food was delicious - both of our entrees were great but I'll say the appetizers really stood out. They're unique and delicious - I would never have thought to put a berry compote on what's essentially a lobster rangoon but it was fantastic. Great vibes as well - the lighting was low but it wasn't too dark, and the decorating was eclectic without being too much. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: 2 appetizers - the deviled eggs with lobster (we already ate two before I took the picture), and the Lobster Crawfish Wontons.
Cocktails! One in the back is the Nirvana something (tequila based), and mine was an off-menu rum punch.

comment.text:
We found this place by mistake, before I actually read that this is a hidden gem of Atlanta. And it truly was! From craft cocktails to delicious Asian fusion entrees, loved the experience! Staff was welcoming and accommodating!
Loved my seafood curry. Ordered it based on Taylor's (bartender) suggestion and was definitely not disappointed!

Clayton was our server and he was amazing. Everything we had was great. The lobster fried rice is delicious and so was our drinks and dessert. We got red sangria and lychee martini, and the banana foster cake for dessert. Highly recommend. Perfect for date night, celebration dinner or girls night out.

Years ago my children and I traveled through Atlanta and decided to stop for a meal. They chose Poor Calvin's as it was highly rated among several sources. It is now one of our favorite places to eat for many reasons. The food excellent. As someone who has bartended in many "5 starish" restaurants, the service is fantastic and the staff goes above and beyond expectations. Tonight was our first time eating inside and we found it to be a little loud, but no matter. The restaurant was full of happy people. There is much to be happy about. 

This is our fourth visit. I've been looking forward to this for 3 weeks. We live 340 miles from ATL and we plan our trips around having a meal at Poor Calvin's. 

Justin was our server who had excellent help from our SA and I'm sorry I missed her name. James was our host with the most. Everyone is kind and happy to help us love our meal. 

Dad's first visit. He made the "clean plate club" status look easy. 

10/10 let's do it again.

photos.caption: FRIED GROUPER & SCALLOP SIAM green beans, mushrooms, pineapples, cashews, tomato, basil, siam sauce, jasmine rice
Japanese Fuji Apple, cover with Caramel, dark chocolate, white chocolate, pecan
PAN SEARED SEA BASS Sun dried tomatoes, artichoke heart Blanco, quail egg.
Coconut milk, vegetables, diver scallops, tiger shrimp, new Zealand mussels, calamari, 1/2 lobster tail. Jasmine Rice.

comment.text:
Poor Calvin's is an modern, intimate eatery featuring an Asian fusion menu, plus both classic and creative cocktails. This is one of the best restaurants my friends and I have ever visited. We really enjoyed the innovative ways that the chef combined influences of Asian and Southern cuisine to create dishes that are truly unparalleled in their excellence. He is truly a mad food genius. Recommended dishes from here are Lobster Fried Rice, Lobster Wontons, Seafood Spring Rolls, and Seafood Curry. Everything was delicious. Parking is limited but there's a lot around the corner as well. Our server was so knowledgeable and described everything we ordered. I will be back again.

Poor Calvin's offer's limited dine-in seating by reservation only. Established in November 2012, Poor Calvin's is a unique oasis in Downtown Atlanta that offers a rare cuisine of Thai fusion with Southern influences. Chef Calvin Phan has brought his perspective of international culinary fusion to the front line of Poor Calvin's. Chef Calvin Phan was exposed to the restaurant business at an early age, having come from a family who owned several restaurants, of all calibers, in Europe. Through this solid foundation, he immediately fell in love with culinary arts and decided to fulfill his life-long dream of working with food by attending culinary school in Germany.

I returned for another special occasion, and unfortunately was let down. The food tasted great as expected, but the experience was not positive - this did not feel like a $200+ dinner. We had a wonderful first experience at Poor Calvin's, but I don't think we'll be returning to dine in-house after this most recent experience. 

*AMBIANCE*  Even though we made reservations well in advance, we were sat at the front of house right next to the door where people walk in. The front of house is a completely different ambiance than the intimate back of house. We asked if we could move, but we're told no other tables were available. 
The door was kept open, so flies were constantly coming in and landing on our food - and they weren't small flies either. We were continuously swatting over our food and unable to relax and have a nice conversation and enjoy our time. The hostess even walked by and commented on how the flies are always "eating good" here. 

*SERVICE* We struggled to get our server's attention throughout the meal. Additionally, our  appetizer did not come out until after the entire meal. This was covered by the restaurant, but definitely added to our disappointment for the evening. 

*TLDR FOR CUSTOMERS*  Food is great. To play it safe, I recommend getting Poor Calvin's as upscale takeout and not dining in house. 

*RECOMMENDATION FOR BUSINESS*  I recommend getting rid of the table right next to the door, and also installing a fan to make sure flies aren't landing on your customers' nice meals. The food is wonderful, but the ambiance completely ruined our celebratory evening. Additionally, at other establishments the seats right by the door are for walk-ins - if you make a reservation, you can ensure that you get an intimate table setting.

Hands down one of my top five favorite restaurants in the city! I've been to Poor Calvin's quite a few times over the years, ranging from special occasions (birthdays, anniversaries) to random dinner dates, but every time I've went I've got top notch service with the most pleasant and attentive staff. Poor Calvin's is not a restaurant with tons of space, but it makes up for it with the ambiance and it's just more of an intimate experience. They always have an amazing special there, so always ask about the specials and I suggest you try it at least one time. This last time I visited Poor Calvin's was with a friend for dinner and I had the Seafood Curry and it did not disappoint!!! They have a lot of good things on their menu but this is one of my favorites!

August 2023 Update: the food is still amazing, but the service has become odd. 

I recently took some out-of-town- guests to Poor Calvin's. 20% gratuity was automatically added to the bill (that was fine) but then our waiter told us that he would like additional gratuity because the 20% goes to "the front of the house and the hosts," so he would only get any extra gratuity on top of the 20%, that we gave. 

My friends are in the restaurant and hospitality business, and this turned them all the way off. If this gratuity policy is true, we didn't understand how a waiter is not considered "front of the house." We paid the extra gratuity on top of the 20% so as not to stiff our waiter, but it was a sour ending to an otherwise great meal.

owner_replies.comment:
Hello Gen, You bring up a very good point and what your server told you is not 100% true. Yes we do have tip out for front of the house but majority of the tips go towards the server them self. 

Could you please describe that server or recall by name so I can hit this up directly and share this amongst the whole team.

Thank you very much; James

comment.text: Poor Calvin's consistently offers a cool vibe, complemented by attentive service and tasty food. However, it's important to note the attire restrictions, so come prepared.  The menu items are costly but affordable. While the servings are decent, I often find myself needing to make a pit stop elsewhere for a burger or wings to truly satisfy my hunger. Despite this, Poor Calvin's remains a favorite spot for its ambiance, service, and unique dishes, making it a worthwhile dining experience.

There comes a time when being a food a-hole pays off! I'm still eating (and drinking), but I needed to start sharing before I forget. It is tasty! I ordered the Duck Dynasty.... yummy.  It's duck medallions in a light sauce. It was NOT greasy at all, which made it go to another level.  Dessert: empanadas..... peach cobbler with goat cheese fried and covered in cinnamon sugar. Sin!!! God forgive me! 

I'm at the bar, and the service was rock solid. Thank you, Milek! Not only was he knowledgeable about the food and drinks, but his timing was strong. 

The environment was southern Asian, yup. I said southern.... brick and old wood shelving and Asian.  It worked... in a strange way!

Whenever I'm in Atlanta for business travel, dinner at Poor Calvin's is a must. The fusion of flavors from the Southeast - both Southeast Asia (Vietnam, Thailand) and the Southeastern U.S. - plus excellent service, is a winner.

An early dinner this week, during an evening thunderstorm, found Calvin's already buzzing at 6p. Warmly welcomed by the host (friendly in a way that I don't often see in NYC), I opted to sit at the bar as my introvert self had already had a long day of meetings. The bartender was excellent, friendly and chill in tone, but exceptionally well informed about the menu and adept at multi-tasking while making a strong drink. I chose the PHO, a unique blend of Bluecoat gin, spices, and toasted ginger and was very happy with the choice.

I hadn't eaten all day - it was one of those days - so I wanted to sample dishes. I started with the watermelon salad, an off the menu special, and it was terrific: juicy watermelon slices topped with a lightly acidic dressing (to cut the sweetness) and with crabmeat. For the other appetizer that I sampled, I debated between the garlic tofu with pineapple dipping sauce or the deviled eggs and crab, served with lavender wine jelly, ghost pepper bbq, and caviar. I opted for the latter, the deviled eggs, but found it messy in appearance and taste. The deviled eggs were lightly fried, which tasted a bit odd. This was a rare miss from Poor Calvin's, so next time I'll do the tofu app.

For my entree, I should have remembered that I was in the South, where big prices ($40 a plate) also equal big portions, again quite unlike my normal NYC spots. I ordered the curry seafood, a massive bowl of lobster, shrimp, scallops, calamari, green mussels, and veggies served with rice and with a sweet coconut milk curry. The dish was very tasty, but too big so I left a lot uneaten.

All in all, Poor Calvin's is like a great, long-time friend: you can go for a while without visits but when you meet up you quickly get comfortable and have a fantastic and memorable time. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Seafood curry: big portion and big flavor.
Deviled eggs with crabmeat, ghost pepper bbq. A bit messy in presentation and taste, a rare miss from Poor Calvin's.
A daily off the menu special watermelon salad special. Crabmeat on top. Yummy!

comment.text: Birthday dinner. From the food to the service, it was top notch quality. I came prepared with what I wanted to order wand for thrown off when the server went over the specials of the night. The special I got was the red snapper and it was worth it.

photos.caption: Lobster Macaroni and Cheese Lobster Macaroni &  Fried Green Tomato, Surimi & Crab Meat

comment.text:
I've been here a couple of times, I usually end up sitting at the bar since there's usually a wait time. The first time I went here the food and drinks were amazing! I ordered the lobster wontons as an appetizer and the special (shaky beef, fried lobster tail and rice) along with a cocktail which were all delicious! The next time I went here, I had the lobster mac and the shaky shrimp which were both okay but again the drinks were good. I've also had friends come here who ordered the lobster fried rice which they spoke highly of. 

I've recommended this place to many of my friends and will continue to do so. Very nice restaurant to have an intimate dinner or catch up with friends. This is one of my favorite restaurants and will continue to be a repeat. 

Tip: if you're not coming solo, get there early or make a reservation. The bar gets full quickly.

Top Tier dining experience from service, atmosphere, selections, presentation and taste. 

Limited parking so arrive early. On site security.

photos.caption: Pad Thai Tiger Shrimp and Half Lobster Tail

comment.text:
My last review of Poor Calvin's was over 9 years ago ago and I must say that they still remain a staple amongst Atlanta restaurants. My friends and I walked over from a Yelp event since we were starving and it was close by. I was excited because I hadn't been here in a few years. The restaurant is intimate and has patio seating as well. The decor is beautiful. The menu features delicious cocktails as well as creative Asian fusion dishes. 

I ordered the Midnight Overture for my cocktail and is was delicious. It's rum based and has blackberries and yuzu. For my appetizer I had the lobster and crawfish wontons. They're as good as the last time I've had them. For my entree, I went with the lamb chops with mashed potatoes and asparagus. I added goat cheese as well. I've previously had this dish before and it's still amazing. My friends had the curry seafood and I'm definitely ordering it next time. Lastly we finished up with the peach cobbler empanadas and OMG. This is one of the best desserts I've had! I don't eat sweets too often, but can't wait to return and have it.

The staff was amazing and I was so pleased that the food and drinks are still as good as the last time I've had them years ago. I will not be waiting that long to return again.

Poor Calvin is more like rich Calvin. The prices are more of $$$ vs $$. The restaurant itself is nice and we did have to wait for a bit even though we had a reservation. Service was just mediocre. Food was nothing to write home about. We got the crispy beef and lobster fried rice. Lobster fried rice could use more lobster for the price. Crispy beef was okay. Overall, I could get the same kind of food for cheaper at a regular Chinese restaurant. Probably get more lobster meat too.

Upon arrival, I saw a dish that looked so fantastic, I thought that's what I'm having, but then another dish came out and it looked just as fantastic, then a third and so on, everything here doesn't just taste great, but presented beautifully.  We were seated outside and it was a beautiful evening, the great food only added to our experience.  Everything we had was simply mouth watering.  The food is a mixture of Asian/Southern fusion and they did everything right, from the Seafood Curry to the ribs and pan seared sea bass, everyone enjoyed the food.  We also had a couple of desserts that were large enough to share.  This is a must if you're visiting Atlanta.

I've been wanting to go here. We were able to beat the dinner rush and snag a seat outside. Luckily it wasn't too hot. I ordered a lychee martini, the lobster wontons and grouper. The lychee martini hit the spot. It was a nice variation with the touch of grapefruit. I didn't really taste the lobster in the wontons but they had a good crisp without being greasy. The presentation of the grouper was beautiful and it matched the taste. It was fresh and had a pleasant mix of flavors - sweet and savory. I recommend making a reservation to get a seat indoors. The bugs were out and wouldn't leave us and our food alone which was annoying. But overall the food was good quality and I loved that they even packed the pineapple in my leftovers. I wasn't blown away but I wish I came with a larger group for a family style meal so I could try more dishes!

photos.caption: Lobster Crawfish Wontons and Lychee martini.

comment.text:
Poor Calvin's is top tier. The service is amazing. This small and quaint restaurant offers high quality and delicious food. I went for brunch and I can't wait to go back to try them for dinner. There is limited parking options.

I ordered a lychee martini, deviled eggs as an appetizer, and the shrimp and grits. The food has an asian theme. The deviled eggs were very different and not traditional, but very good. It came with crab meat and mango. The shrimp and grits again were not traditional, but was very tasty.

photos.caption: Shrimp , Cajun Sausage and Cheese Grits

comment.text: Amazing dishes. Great service and the ambiance is always chill and cool. The Lobster Fried Rice is always a hit! And for a "happy ending" get the Peach Empanadas

photos.caption: Poor Calvin's Peach Empanadas!!! Prepare yourself!

comment.text:
My party of 7 went to Poor Calvin's on a Thursday evening and it didn't disappoint but it definitely did! Only 6 people ordered because the 7th had a food allergy... 

We had a reservation which I highly suggest because the restaurant is small. We were promptly greeted by our waitress who was Johnny on the spot the entire night! The tip is automatically included in the bill and she sure did work for it. 

We ordered drinks, appetizers, & a few meals to share! The portions are plentiful so you can definitely share a meal with someone. 

If you don't like something, too bad! They will not take anything back  or exchange it if you don't like it. It clearly states this at the bottom of the menu so we knew to not even ask. 

Got a food allergy? Too bad. They will make zero accommodations for you. Our waitress made sure to tell us that everything is cooked in the same wok and that's that! That's also clearly stated at the bottom on the menu. 

I opted for the lobster fried rice that was priced at over $40. Was it good?? Yes. Worth over $40? Absolutely not. 


I also ordered lobster Mac and cheese to go and it was so spicy, I could barely eat it. I guess I missed the part of the menu that mentions spice cause I was not prepared! 

The potstickers appetizer: 3 stars 
The dessert: 3 stars 
Sangria: 5 stars
Ambiance: 4 stars 

The waitress told us that Calvin was in the back and we asked if he could come out. She said it was too busy to say hello to his customers which was a little disappointing.

Our night at Poor Calvin's cost us almost $1k. Was it worth it?! No. But go see for yourself I guess!

We were lucky to find street parking but I'm sure it's impossible to find on the weekends.

So our tour guide, bell cap, local peeps and bartender all expressed coming to this restaurant. 

Started in 2012 with a trained chef/owner, this gem of a restaurant will provide you with an exquisite culinary experience. 

The fresh flavors were fantastic and blended nicely in every dish. Our table enjoyed southern comfort foods like lobster mac and cheese and greens to fabulous seafood. 

Indoor and outdoor seating allows this venue to expand the kind of experience you want from intimate to casual.  Enoch our sever was a fabulous host who provided intricate details of every dish we asked about, a superb resource as we decided the direction our dinner would take. 

This is a wow experience, hands down one of the best restaurants in Atlanta. Reservations recommended.

photos.caption: Better picture of the yellow curry with prawns and lobster tail
Toasted Pound cake with bananas foster and coffee Bailey's ice cream grand  marnier  strawberries
Buttermilk Fried Chicken, Lobster Mac and greens- true Southern Comfort

comment.text: Most unique flavors you'll find. We love this place! Service and food are consistently 10/10

photos.caption: Limited special menu item. Wish it were a permanent option!

comment.text:
The Food was awesome. I will definitely promote and tell folks that they need go there to enjoy that Soul asian fusion. 

The service was awesome as well. Presented food in timely manner and always came by to check on me and wife on anything. The Bartenders were great and very sociable. They kept us laughing and having a good time. We will definitely come back from our 2 hour drive to spend at Poor Calvin's. Love it!

We were visiting Atlanta for the weekend and after the event were hungry. I saw this restaurant had really good reviews so we stopped by. We walked in and they asked if we had a reservation and we didn't but they were able to fit us in. We had a party of 5 and were so thankful they were able to accommodate us so late. The ambiance was very laid back and gave date night vibes which I loved even though we were there with family it wasn't too much. The waitress Joy was awesome she game so many great recommendations and was spot on for each. I ordered the lobster fried rice and a glass of Cabernet and everything was so good. All the vegetables and colors that were packed into this one dish was phenomenal. I would highly recommended this dish and this restaurant if you're in Atlanta or visiting.

Absolutely wonderful meal! The pad Thai was delicious but the lobster mac n cheese and fried chicken was even better. 
We also ordered the chicken and pork dumplings which were melt in your mouth delicious. Probably my favorite thing on the menu. 

Service was also top tier.
